fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Customs, Energy, Environment, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: All EU legislative and policy developments which are directly or indirectly of relevance to the Governments of Guernsey and Jersey, for example, data protection, the digital single market, EU restrictive measures (sanctions), financial services, anti-money laundering and countering terrorist financing, tax, aviation and judicial cooperation (including on asset recovery) and Brexit.
section: VI - Organisations representing local, regional and municipal authorities, other public or mixed entities, etc.
goals__remit:
The Channel Islands Brussels Office (CIBO) was established in 2011 to promote and protect the interests of the Channel Islands in the European Union. It is the joint office of the Governments of Guernsey and Jersey ("the Channel Islands").    
 
CIBO represents the Channel Islands to the EU institutions and advises the two Governments on EU policy issues. 
 
Guernsey and Jersey are autonomous dependencies of the British Crown.  They form part of the Community Customs Territory, but are outside the EU for most other purposes.
